item.title: Almost a third of people in Gaza not eating for days, UN food programme warns
item.description: Israel faces increasing pressure from Western allies to lift restrictions into the flow of aid into Gaza.

item.title: UK condemns Hong Kong cash offer for help in arresting activists
item.description: David Lammy and Yvette Cooper describe the bounties as "another example of transnational repression".

item.title: Artist explores the toxic mining legacy of Zambia's 'black mountains'
item.description: A major exhibition about the dangerous lives of the boys and young men who scour slag heaps in search of copper.

item.title: School-leavers losing their lives for Russia in Putin's war with Ukraine
item.description: Russia has promised that no 18-year-olds will be sent to fight in Ukraine, but the BBC finds many have already been killed.

item.title: Thais and Cambodians slug it out on social media, as border tensions flare
item.description: A war of words is raging on social media, a years-long battleground for Thais and Cambodians.
